unnormalised: **Rental Agreements: Kuchh Tips & Tricks! (Real Estate & Property)**
normalised: **Rental Agreements: Some Tips and Tricks! (Real Estate and Property)**

unnormalised: So, you're planning to rent a place? Awesome! Getting a solid rental agreement is *super* important, yaar. Don't just sign on the dotted line without reading everything carefully. Trust me, you don't want surprises later.
normalised: So, you're planning to rent a place? Awesome! Getting a solid rental agreement is super important, friend. Don't just sign on the dotted line without reading everything carefully. Trust me, you don't want surprises later.

unnormalised: First things first, **read the damn thing!** I know it's boring, like watching your aunties gossip, but it's essential. Pay special attention to the clauses on rent payment (when's it due? What's the penalty for late payment? Like a Rs. 500 fine?), security deposit refund (how much? When will you get it back? Usually within 30 days), and repairs.
normalised: First things first, **read the damn thing!** I know it's boring, like watching your aunties gossip, but it's essential. Pay special attention to the clauses on rent payment (when's it due? What's the penalty for late payment? Like a rupee five hundred fine?), security deposit refund (how much? When will you get it back? Usually within thirty days), and repairs.

unnormalised: Speaking of repairs, who's responsible for what? Leaking tap? You or the landlord? Make sure it's clearly stated. Also, are there any restrictions on things like painting the walls or having pets? My friend Anjali got fined heavily for painting her rented flat a bright pink (it looked like a Onam decoration gone wrong!), even though the agreement said no alterations without permission.

unnormalised: Negotiate! Don't be afraid to ask your landlord, Mr. Sharma, to adjust clauses that don't work for you. Maybe he wants to increase the rent by 10% every year. Try to negotiate it down to 5% or fix it for 2 years.
normalised: Negotiate! Don't be afraid to ask your landlord, Mister Sharma, to adjust clauses that don't work for you. Maybe he wants to increase the rent by ten percent every year. Try to negotiate it down to five percent or fix it for two years.

unnormalised: Get everything in writing! Oral promises are worth less than that half-eaten plate of biryani you left on the table.
normalised: Get everything in writing! Oral promises are worth less than that half-eaten plate of biryani you left on the table.

unnormalised: Finally, make sure the agreement includes the property address (flat no. 402, XYZ Apartments, Bandra), the landlord's details, your details, the rental amount, and the duration of the agreement (usually 11 months in Maharashtra to avoid registration). Consider getting it notarized. This gives it more legal weight. Good luck finding your perfect place!
